author: rkeithhill
body:
### Summary of the new feature / enhancement

My profile takes ~640 ms to load which is barely noticeable but I get this extra message every single time I start a new session:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5177512/155819540-d0aef7e2-9bdf-4cd3-a0fc-c8cf511f36a7.png)

With the new minimized startup banner in preview.2, can we consider bumping the threshold for showing the timing info on how long it takes to process my profile?  Maybe from the current 500 ms to 1 s?  It's handy to know if my long startup time is due to my profile but maybe not every time I start a new session.  I know my profile takes a bit longer and I'm at peace with that.  If only PowerShell wouldn't keep reminding me every time it starts.  :-)

Also, I notice that the wall time is noticeably longer than 637ms from seeing `PowerShell 7.xx` to my prompt appearing.  It appears to me to be closer to 1500ms.  So the profile loading accounts for less than half the actual startup time.  But I get that the only knob the user has to twiddle is what they're doing in their profile.

### Proposed technical implementation details (optional)

**Option 1:** Consider adding a new start up parameter `-TimeProfileLoad` or something like that.  Only when this parameter is specified would you display the profile processing time.  In this case, you could also consider being more granular e.g.:
```
> pwsh -TimeProfileLoad
PowerShell 7.3.0-preview.3
 1100ms : Loading C:\Program Files\PowerShell\7-preview\profile.ps1
  637ms : Loading C:\Users\Keith\Documents\PowerShell\profile.ps1
   75ms : Loading C:\Users\Keith\Documents\PowerShell\Microsoft.PowerShell_profile.ps1
 1812ms : Loading system and personal profiles
 C:\Users\Keith> 
 ```

**Option 2:** Perhaps we just bump the current threshold for displaying the message up to 1 sec.

**Option 3:**  We make the threshold configurable.  It defaults to the current 500 ms but folks could adjust that based on their profile.  IOW I might want to see this if it is taking longer than normal to process my profile.  Where "normal" is what you'd configure for your threshold value.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/addfdd88d50265b0b25d83c22ef08084572d2985/src/Microsoft.PowerShell.ConsoleHost/host/msh/ConsoleHost.cs#L1848-L1851

You could disable banner as a workaround.

I'm afraid this is an area of personal preference - some will want 1 ms, some 10 seconds - how to find a compromise?

comments.author: rkeithhill
comments.body:
> I'm afraid this is an area of personal preference

Yup, of the options I suggested above, option 3 (configurable threshold) is likely better than option 2 (bump it to 1s).

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: There could be option 4 - informational logging :-)

comments.author: jhoneill
comments.body: I'd like it to be a **config option**.  It's a preference. I look at it and think "what can I do knowing it took 600ms or 700ms to load the profile." I waste more time looking at the message than that. So I'd set a very high threshold. Those who want to know this every time can set 1ms.

comments.author: theJasonHelmick
comments.body: Thank you @rkeithhill for raising this. The WG discussed this and would like to propose a slightly different idea. Rather than chasing a unknown number to set the timeout - We would propose a new switch for pwsh.exe that enables/disables the message. The default would be disabled to respect the new concise view of the prompt. There will be no timeout, the time will be displayed (even 1ms) if enabled.

comments.author: rkeithhill
comments.body: @theJasonHelmick That works for me!  With that in mind, I'll close the PR I was working on. Is anybody assigned to implement the new pwsh switch?  If not, I think I should be able to do that. If you'd like.

comments.author: rkeithhill
comments.body: @theJasonHelmick @daxian-dbw I have created another PR #17535 that disables the profile load time message by default and adds a command line parameter to always show it.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: The issue will be automatically closed when the PR gets merged.

title: Consider adjusting threshold for showing the load time for personal & system profiles to 1 sec
